description:
Proudly located in Wailuku, Hawaii, Menzer Law Firm, PLLC, brings world-class personal injury representation right home to Maui. We are a winning team that focuses completely on the success of our clients.

Team approach

Our law firm has many advantages, but our true strength is our ability to come together to win cases. At the helm, Matt Menzer has been representing injured people for more than 30 years. He has held a license to practice in Hawaii since 1990.
Supporting Matt, we have a core group of dedicated professionals and experienced attorneys. Every case gets the personal attention it needs for the best possible outcome.

Wide recognition

Our attorneys hold several professional distinctions. Beyond our various bar associations, we are members of Super Lawyers (in both Washington and Hawaii), the International Society of Primerus Law Firms and the Multi-Million Dollar Advocates Forum. Additionally, we hold AV Preeminent* from Martindale-Hubbell, which is the highest possible peer rating for high ethical standards and positive results.

Community focus

As individuals and as an organization, we believe that service should come first. In our professional capacity, we serve injured people as they fight for what they deserve against large corporations and insurance companies. As neighbors, we give back to the community by funding scholarships and volunteering our own time.

Broad practice

Menzer Law Firm, PLLC, has the experience, resources and knowledge to handle a variety of personal injury cases. These include medical malpractice, auto accidents, wrongful death and nursing home abuse, among others. Free consultations are available, as are virtual appointments.

*AV®, AV Preeminent®, Martindale-Hubbell Distinguished and Martindale-Hubbell Notable are certification marks used under license in accordance with the Martindale-Hubbell certification procedures, standards and policies. Martindale-Hubbell® is the facilitator of a peer review rating process. Ratings reflect the anonymous opinions of members of the bar and the judiciary. Martindale-Hubbell® Peer Review RatingTM fall into two categories - legal ability and general ethical standards.
